alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued September 16 at 1:48PM AKDT until September 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...South winds 45 to 65 mph with gusts of 75 to 85 mph expected. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 4 PM Today to 10 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose objects, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A powerful storm is over the central Bering Sea and is tracking northeast towards St. Lawrence Island through Saturday morning. Winds will steadily increase through the day today. The strongest winds will be along the coast to the west of the Kuskokwim Delta and over Nunivak Island, where gusts between 75 and 85 mph will be likely. Farther inland, sustained winds are expected to be around 45 mph with gusts to 70 mph possible.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside near structures or any material that may break or become dislodged due to wind stress. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
